snippet: Idaho’s initial refusal to pass a child support bill threatened an international agreement that would compel parents to support their children living in foreign countries.
abstract: Idaho approves child support bill after governor calls legislators back for special session; original bill, which brought opposition from critics saying it forced state to sign onto international treaty governing provision of child support from parents living in foreign countries, was amended to ensure Idaho cannot enforce orders incompatible with state laws.
lead_paragraph: Idaho’s initial refusal to pass a child support bill threatened an international agreement that would compel parents to support their children living in foreign countries.

headline.main: Idaho Approves Child Support Bill, Removing Treaty Roadblock
headline.print_headline: Idaho Approves Support Bill, Removing Treaty Roadblock
